APPENDIX O

HOUSE BILL NO. 385. 3

(ii) shall receive or prepare a detailed plan for the rede-
velopment of any Redevelopment Area, and, subject to the
final approval of the Commission on City Plan of Baltimore
City, may adopt such a plan as the Redevelopment Plan for
such Redevelopment Area, and may from time to time, subject
to the same approval, adopt amendments thereto;

(iii) shall prepare or obtain a complete financial plan of
operation for the redevelopment of such Redevelopment Area
or project comprising a part thereof;

(iv) may acquire by purchase, lease or condemnation real
estate in any Redevelopment Area for redevelopment in accord-
ance with the applicable Redevelopment Plan;

(v) after the acquisition, by purchase or option, of at least
50% of the land in any Redevelopment Area, may exercise, in
accordance with Article 83A of the Annotated Code of Mary-
land, the power of eminent domain to condemn and acquire the
other land in such Redevelopment Area, for redevelopment in
accordance with the applicable Rédevelopment Plan;

(vi) may preserve for, sell, lease, transfer and convey to the
United States, the State of Maryland, the Mayor and City
Council of Baltimore, or any department or agency of said
Governments, such portions of real estate in any project area,
or any rights therein, as are required for public use; and may
sell, lease, transfer and convey for redevelopment in accordance
with the applicable Redevelopment Plan, any portions of the
real estate in such project area, not required for public use, to
one or more persons, firms, and corporations, at prices con-
sistent with the new uses prescribed for such land, but only
after the Board of Estimates has been satisfied as to the finan-
cial and legal ability of each such person, firm and corporation
to carry out the purposes of this Paragraph (13A);

(vii) may petition for and accept from the appropriate
Federal Department, the State of Maryland, the Mayor and
City Council of Baltimore, or any other source or agency, loans
or grants of money for the preparation of Redevelopment Plans
and for the acquisition of land and improvements comprising
any Redevelopment Area;

(viii) shall require in any sale or lease of land to any private
corporation, firm or person, provisions obligating the pur-

" chasers or lessees of such land to begin the building or im-

provements within a reasonable period of time, and appro-
priate covenants and restrictions in the contract of sale or
lease to maintain the standards of population density, property
maintenance, type of land use and other standards established
as above provided, and such covenants and restrictions shall
be made binding on any subsequent transferee, purchaser,
lessee, or other successor in interest.

(d) The Commission shall have no power to use the faith
and credit of Baltimore City or State of Maryland in acquiring
land either by purchase, lease or condemnation and shall not
have or exercise any taxing power.

(e) No member of the Commission on City Plan or the Balti-
more Redevelopment Commission and no employee of either
Commission shall be or become interested in any way in any
of the properties acquired, or in any of the corporations, firms
or persons who undertake the redevelopment of any area under
the authority of this paragraph.

Sec. 2. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall take
effect June 1, 1945. '

95
